intro.title: First Trimester Diet Guide
intro.description:
You've just seen those two pink lines, and life suddenly feels different. Along with the excitement come so many questions — What should I eat? What should I avoid?

In the first trimester, your baby is tiny but already starting to grow a heart, brain, and other organs. The food you choose now is the first little gift you give your baby — full of nourishment and care.

sections.title: Breakfast Options
sections.description: Nutritious breakfast ideas to start your day right during the first trimester

items.name: Fruits
items.description: Banana, orange, apple, or ripe papaya provide vitamins, fiber, and hydration.

items.name: Nuts
items.description: Almonds and walnuts are packed with healthy fats and omega-3, great for your baby's brain and eyes.

items.name: Coconut water
items.description: Natural electrolytes, gentle on the stomach, keeps you hydrated.

items.name: Roasted makhana
items.description: Provides protein and calcium, perfect for a light snack between meals.

items.name: Oats porridge
items.description: High in fiber and complex carbs, keeps energy steady and helps prevent constipation.

items.name: Daliya (broken wheat porridge)
items.description: Easy to digest, rich in protein and iron, supports gentle digestion in early pregnancy.

items.name: Whole-grain toast with paneer or nut butter
items.description: Combines protein and complex carbs, helps reduce morning nausea.

items.name: Smoothie / Milkshake
items.description: Fruits with milk or yogurt, plus chia/flax seeds, for hydration, vitamins, and omega-3s.

items.name: Idli / Dhokla
items.description: Fermented, light, and easy to digest; provides protein and probiotics for gut health.

items.name: Upma / Poha
items.description: Carbs with vegetables, gentle on the stomach, provides fiber, iron, and B vitamins.

items.name: Sprouts
items.description: Moong or mixed sprouts are rich in protein, fiber, and iron; great for energy and digestion.

items.name: Eggs (if non-vegetarian)
items.description: Boiled or scrambled eggs provide high-quality protein and choline for baby's brain development.

items.name: Paneer cubes
items.description: Protein-rich, easy to digest, adds calcium for bone health.

items.name: Curd / Yogurt
items.description: Good source of protein and probiotics, supports gut health and digestion.

items.name: Ragi porridge / Ragi malt
items.description: High in calcium, fiber, and slow-digesting carbs for steady energy.

items.name: Whole-grain muffins / pancakes (homemade)
items.description: Provides complex carbs and can be fortified with nuts or seeds.

items.name: Dates
items.description: Natural energy, iron-rich, helps combat early pregnancy fatigue.

items.name: Peanut butter on toast
items.description: Protein and healthy fats, helps stabilize blood sugar.

sections.title: Mid Day Snack
sections.description: Healthy snack options to keep your energy up during the day

items.name: Fruits
items.description: Banana, orange, apple, or ripe papaya provide vitamins, fiber, and hydration.

items.name: Nuts
items.description: Almonds and walnuts are packed with healthy fats and omega-3, great for your baby's brain and eyes.

items.name: Coconut water
items.description: Natural electrolytes, gentle on the stomach.

items.name: Roasted makhana
items.description: Protein and calcium, perfect for a light snack.

sections.title: Veg Lunch Option
sections.description: Complete vegetarian lunch options for balanced nutrition

items.name: Chapati + dal (moong/masoor) + aloo-methi subzi + salad
items.description: Light, iron-rich, and easy to digest.

items.name: Rice + rajma + cucumber salad + curd
items.description: Protein-packed and filling.

items.name: Chapati + chole + bhindi/tinda sabzi
items.description: Balances protein and fiber.

items.name: Vegetable khichdi + kadhi + beetroot stir fry
items.description: Comfort meal with probiotics.

items.name: Vegetable pulao + mix dal tadka + raita
items.description: Balanced carbs, proteins, and probiotics.

items.name: Stuffed paratha (paneer/palak) + curd + salad
items.description: Protein + calcium-rich.

items.name: Chapati + lauki chana dal + carrot-beans sabzi
items.description: Light, cooling, and nutritious.

items.name: Curd rice + sautéed spinach + papad
items.description: Probiotic and iron-rich.

items.name: Vegetable stew + appam/idiyappam
items.description: Mild and nourishing.

items.name: Tofu/paneer curry + chapati + green salad
items.description: Great vegetarian protein source.

sections.title: Bedtime Snacks
sections.description: Light and nutritious snacks for evening and bedtime during first trimester

items.name: Vegetable sandwich or parantha with curd
items.description: Balanced carbs + protein.

items.name: Warm milk with haldi/elaichi
items.description: Aids sleep and contributes to baby's bone health.

items.name: Light soups
items.description: Vegetable, tomato, or chicken; hydrating and easy to digest.

sections.title: Non-veg Lunch Option
sections.description: Protein-rich non-vegetarian lunch options for complete nutrition. Tip: Include spinach, carrot, beetroot—they help your baby's eyes and keep your digestion smooth.

items.name: Chapati + egg curry + bhindi sabzi + salad
items.description: Protein + fiber.

items.name: Rice + fish curry (lightly spiced) + lauki sabzi
items.description: Omega-3 + hydration.

items.name: Grilled chicken + chapati + spinach dal
items.description: Iron + protein combo.

items.name: Rice + chicken curry + beans-poriyal
items.description: Wholesome South Indian style meal.

items.name: Chapati + mutton soup + carrot-beans sabzi
items.description: Strengthens hemoglobin.

items.name: Egg bhurji + chapati + aloo-gobhi sabzi
items.description: Quick, filling protein meal.

items.name: Fish fry (light pan fry) + dal tadka + rice
items.description: Omega-3 + fiber from dal.

items.name: Light chicken biryani (homemade) + cucumber raita
items.description: High fiber content.

sample_diet_charts.title: Vegetarian Daily Diet Chart
sample_diet_charts.description: A balanced vegetarian meal plan for first trimester nutrition

items: Plain warm water or ginger-lemon water (helps nausea, better than jeera water)
Vegetable poha/upma/idli (choose 1) + glass of milk (instead of curd, which may worsen nausea in the morning)
Seasonal fruit like apple, pear, or papaya (avoid unripe papaya)
OR 1 banana if nausea is not severe
Dal / chana / rajma / paneer for protein
Roasted chana or handful of dry fruits/dates + lemon water or coconut water
Vegetable daliya / khichdi / curd rice (if well tolerated)
Add 1 small bowl of curd if not feeling nauseous
Warm turmeric milk OR plain warm milk (helps relax and adds calcium)

sample_diet_charts.title: Non-Vegetarian Diet Chart
sample_diet_charts.description: Protein-rich meal plan with non-vegetarian options for first trimester

items: Warm lemon water OR plain warm water
5–6 soaked almonds (replace later in day if nausea in morning)
2 chapatis OR small portion rice (not both in large qty)
Moong sprouts chaat with cucumber, tomato, lemon
OR roasted makhana / chana if sprouts cause gas

sample_diet_charts.title: Alternate Vegetarian Diet Chart
sample_diet_charts.description: Another nutritious vegetarian meal plan with protein rotation and variety

items: 2 soaked dates + 3–4 soaked almonds (instead of biscuits/khakra)
Vegetable besan cheela / moong dal chilla with mint chutney
1 small glass buttermilk (if tolerated, otherwise skip)
Fruit bowl: papaya (ripe), pomegranate, or apple (small portion)
Paneer bhurji / soya curry (protein rotation instead of only dal)
Seasonal sabzi (palak, lauki, beans, bhindi — light & fibrous)
Handful of roasted foxnuts (makhana) or boiled corn
Vegetable khichdi / dalia with mixed veggies
Optional: 1 small dry fig or date for iron + natural sweetness

sample_diet_charts.title: Alternate Non-Vegetarian Diet Chart
sample_diet_charts.description: Another protein-rich meal plan with light dinner and flexible options

items: Ginger infused warm water or Warm lemon water OR plain warm water
2 chapatis OR ½ cup rice (avoid both in large amounts together)
Moong sprouts chaat with cucumber, tomato, lemon, if sprouts cause bloating, replace with roasted chana / makhana
Vegetable dalia khichdi OR plain dal + lauki / palak sabzi
1 boiled egg (instead of heavy curry at night)
Warm milk with elaichi OR haldi
Optional: 1 dry fig for natural iron + fiber

unsafe.name: Nutmeg (Jaiphal)
unsafe.reason: In excess, may act as uterine stimulant.

unsafe.name: Peanuts (raw, street roasted)
unsafe.reason: Caution: Can trigger allergies; avoid raw/stale ones.

unsafe.name: Excess Dates (>4–5/day)
unsafe.reason: May raise blood sugar & cause excess weight gain early.

unsafe.name: Fenugreek Seeds (Methi in large amounts)
unsafe.reason: May trigger uterine contractions if overused.

unsafe.name: Ajwain (Carom seeds) in high amounts
unsafe.reason: Too stimulating for uterus in early pregnancy.

unsafe.name: Mustard Seeds (in medicinal doses)
unsafe.reason: May cause uterine irritation. Normal cooking amount is fine.

safe.name: Ajwain Water
safe.amount: [LIMITED] ½ tsp seeds in warm water

unsafe.name: Packaged Fruit Juices
unsafe.reason: High sugar, preservatives; no real nutrition.

unsafe.name: Soda / Cola / Cold Drinks
unsafe.reason: High caffeine, sugar, and gas → bloating.

unsafe.name: Energy Drinks (Red Bull, etc.)
unsafe.reason: Too much caffeine & artificial additives.

unsafe.name: Alcohol
unsafe.reason: Directly linked to miscarriage, fetal alcohol syndrome.

unsafe.name: Excess Coffee (>1 cup/day)
unsafe.reason: High caffeine → miscarriage risk, low birth weight.

unsafe.name: Herbal Teas (unknown blends)
unsafe.reason: Many herbs (like aloe, licorice, sage) unsafe in pregnancy.

unsafe.name: Unpasteurized Milk / Lassi
unsafe.reason: Risk of infection (listeria, brucella).

unsafe.name: Excess Aam Panna (from raw mango)
unsafe.reason: May trigger uterine contractions in some women.

unsafe.name: Papaya (raw / semi-ripe)
unsafe.reason: Contains latex-like compounds that may trigger uterine contractions.

unsafe.name: Pineapple (excess / raw)
unsafe.reason: Contains bromelain, which may soften cervix if taken in large amounts.

unsafe.name: Street Food (golgappa, chaat, samosa, pakora)
unsafe.reason: High risk of infection, contamination & acidity.

unsafe.name: Processed Cheese / Mayonnaise
unsafe.reason: Risk of bacterial contamination if not pasteurized.

unsafe.name: Fried Snacks (bhujia, namkeen, chips)
unsafe.reason: High in trans fats, salt → bloating, acidity, weight gain.

unsafe.name: Pickles (excess)
unsafe.reason: Too much salt & preservatives, worsens water retention & BP.

unsafe.name: Undercooked Meat / Fish
unsafe.reason: May contain parasites (toxoplasmosis, listeria) harmful in pregnancy.

unsafe.name: High Mercury Fish (Shark, Mackerel, Swordfish)
unsafe.reason: Mercury affects baby's brain & nervous system.

unsafe.name: Liver (Kaleja / Liver curry)
unsafe.reason: Excess vitamin A can cause birth defects.

unsafe.name: Half-Boiled Eggs
unsafe.reason: Risk of salmonella infection. Must be fully cooked.
